column4: Yeah nerdshell , if they update to a newer kernel before they've ensured stability... and your home computer crashes, well it sucks. If they do it, and a business shuts down because of crashes... now they'e costing people money. They try to avoid that.
You can always compile your own kernel, and run ubuntu on it... But you may experience...odd... behavior. (you can always choose the older kernel in grub though)
neil, how do they show in your mtab/fstab?
Yeah, that's the difference between ubuntu and Win updates
